Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libtirpc
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: libtirpc bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The libtirpc packages contain SunLib's implementation of transport independent RPC (TI-RPC) documentation. This includes a library required by programs in the nfs-utils and rpcbind packages. This update fixes the following bugs: Prior to this update, non-blocking write actions did not time out when the write socket buffer was full. As a consequence, a number of applications, including the rpc.mountd daemon, became unresponsive when the write() system call was used. Because rpc.mountd could not respond to the client's mounts, this also led to a denial of service (DOS) on the NFS server. With this update, non-blocking write actions time out properly when the write socket buffer is full, and the described problems no longer occur. (BZ#1162714) Due to buffer overruns in the libtirpc library, the rpcbind utility sometimes terminated unexpectedly with a segmentation fault. With this update, buffer is allocated by the svcauth_gss_validate() call, which avoids the buffer overruns and thus prevents the rpcbind crashes. (BZ#1102765) Users of libtirpc are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
